title: Do You Burn More Calories in the Heat?
meta_description: Do you burn more calories in the heat? Discover if exercising in hot conditions increases calorie burn by 5-15%, plus factors affecting expenditure and tips for safe workouts.
h1: Do You Burn More Calories in the Heat?
assumptions: Moderate aerobic exercise (e.g., jogging at 5 mph); ambient temperature 90°F/32°C with humidity; unacclimated individual; compared to normal conditions.
disclaimer: Calorie burn varies by fitness level, intensity, hydration, acclimation, and environmental factors. Consult a professional for personalized advice.

quick_answer.text: Yes, you burn about 10% more calories in the heat due to elevated heart rate and thermoregulation efforts.

faqs.q: Do you burn more calories in the heat during exercise?
faqs.a: Yes, typically 5-15% more due to increased cardiovascular strain and sweating.

faqs.q: How much extra calories does heat add to workouts?
faqs.a: About 30-50 extra kcal per hour for moderate exercise, depending on temperature and humidity.

faqs.q: Does heat affect resting calorie burn?
faqs.a: Slightly; basal metabolic rate may rise 5-10% in hot environments from thermoregulation.

faqs.q: Is it safe to exercise in the heat for more calorie burn?
faqs.a: Possible but risky; hydrate well, monitor for heat exhaustion, and acclimate gradually.

faqs.q: Why do you burn more calories in hot weather?
faqs.a: Body expends energy cooling itself via sweat and higher heart rate to maintain core temperature.
